content.rendered:
Active Mission: Ukraine Crisis
GEM has been on the ground since day two of the Ukrainian crisis. We have sent 532 trucks of aid into the region and housed or relocated 38,793 refugees. GEM is also now repairing multiple key buildings. Please check out Our Work for details.
Our Work
Active Mission: Southeast US Floods
Global Empowerment Mission BStrong is responding in the first phase of disaster relief, we are currently on the ground in the Southeastern United States.
Our Work
Active Program: Hope for Bucha
GEM in partnership with the Bucha City Council & Quality of Life UA has fully activated its phase 2-3 programs. This program is aimed to bring hope back to many Bucha communities by starting light repairs on homes, apartment buildings, schools and hospitals.
Our Work
Active Mission: California Fires
In July 2022, we activated our Phase 1 response to the Oak Fire in Mariposa County, California. When the McKinney Fire broke soon thereafter, we pivoted plans quickly to service both fires.
Our Work
Previous
Next

Our main objectives are to deliver the most amount of aid, to the most amount of people in need, in the shortest amount of time and with the least amount of costs to our donors. This also applies to our rebuilding efforts.

Founder Michael Capponi

Bahamas
On August 24, 2019, the Category 5 Hurricane Dorian struck the Bahamas, and was the worst natural disaster in the country’s history with wind speeds of 183 mph and $3.4 billion+ reported damages.

Earthquakes
2010

Haiti Earthquake

Haiti
On January 12, 2010, the Haiti earthquake was a catastrophic magnitude 7.0 Mw earthquake, causing more than 200,000 deaths and $8 billion in damage, with 52 aftershocks and 3 million affected people.

Featured Programs

Sustainability

Global Relief Network

Welcome to GEM’s global aid network. A worldwide matrix consisting of community drives, corporate donors, private donors, government and international NGOs all working together under a streamlined efficient umbrella operated by GEM BStrong.
Donate
Our Work
Education

Smart Class

GEM Bstrong in partnership with SmartAID, LHI, and MWCF, we have created an education initiative and network to support Ukrainian students in Poland, Romania, Moldova, and beyond. With an influx of hundreds of thousands of new students under refugee status, schools and families are facing multiple difficulties. In response to this, the Smart Class program was created.
Donate
Our Work
Family Necessities Kits

Family Necessities Kits

Our Family Necessities Kits each contain supplies ranging from food, snacks, hydration, hygiene, health supplements and COVID 19 prevention kits.
